conclusion: Let's tackle this problem step by step.
Graph is a position-time graph with y-axis labeled as x/t in meters per second and x-axis as time in seconds.
The graph might be a velocity-time graph because y-axis units are meters per second.
The y-axis labeled x/t in meters per second is consistent with velocity.
Speed is the magnitude of velocity.
Line starts at t = -2 seconds and x/t = 0 m/s, increases linearly to t = 0 seconds and x/t = 10 m/s.
Negative time represents time before some initial event.
Slope of the line is the change in velocity over time, which is acceleration.
Calculate slope: m = (10 m/s - 0 m/s) / (0 s - (-2) s) = 5 m/s².
Equation of the line: x/t = mt + c, with m = 5 and c = 10.
Verify equation: At t = -2 s, x/t = 0, confirms m = 5.
Need to find velocity at t = 2 seconds, beyond graphed region.
Assume motion continues linearly, use equation x/t = 5t + 10.
Velocity at t = 2 s is 20 m/s, speed is the magnitude of velocity.
